result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alberto Salgado

records.addlTxt: $210 installment for SCRAM

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit .It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.** Do not drive at all.
NG plea entered.

8:57 AM Defendant Alberto Salgado in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Alberto Salgado.  Attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant .Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense requests to modify bond.
State objects to bond modification.
BTC: Bond modified to $5,000 signature bond, scram and do not drive at all.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

10:39 AM Defendant Alberto Salgado not in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Alberto Salgado.  Attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re: Bond hearing
Atty Solis withdrawn due to Atty Ramirez from SPD being appointed
Atty Xavier Solis

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit .It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**

2:30 PM Defendant Alberto Salgado in court.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. previously sworn.
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: set for another status conference, due to no attorney yet. Bond modified to $500 cash, ordered SCRAM.
Defendant is taken into custody on new cash bond.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto Salgado not in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant showed up at RCAP and was drunk, RCAP has sent him home. 
BTC: Court adjourns date. Deft needs to appear sober
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
RCAP Progress Report

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto Salgado in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. Sworn In
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
An amended complaint was filed added count 4. Complaint given to defendant. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits. Court grants defendants PFAC at a repayment of $50 a month to start in 60 days. Defendant reminded of his bond conditions and advised not to drink alcohol. 
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Racine County Alternatives Program- Progress Report

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto Salgado in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Interpreter, Dawn Maldonado, appeared on behalf of the defendant. 
Defendant has not reported to RCAP since being put on bond, gives explanation for failing to report to RCAP. Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Continue of waiving time limits. Defendant needs t file a PFAC with the clerks window, Must repot to RCAP for testing per bond conditions.
Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BTC: Matter adjourned. Finding of good cause to waive time limits.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto Salgado appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Alberto Salgado. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. Sworn in.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
